result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander C Beaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution total is $3,088.05 to be paid as follows: $15.00 to Diane A., $2,178.09 to Emily R., $175.00 to Jenna S. and $719.96 to Randal S. - to be paid as a Condition of Probation. Restitution hearing set for Michael G. and American Family Insurance Co. on 3/26/15 at 3:00 pm.

AS OF 3/26/15: Restitution to remain at ZERO in regards to Michael G and American Family, and restitution for Emily R. remains the same BUT to be joint and several.

Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination fo schooling.

No contact with any victims or any co-actors.
Follow through with any conditions recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time (nonworking hours) FORTHWITH. Defendant to serve his first 60 days jail consecutive to his Walworth Co Case. Standard release conditions. LAST 60 days jail w/Huber STAYED. (consecutive) to be used at Agent's discretion. If the defendant gets electronic monitoring w/Walworth Co he can have electronic monitoring in Waukesha Co. Sentences are consecutive.
AMENDED 01-06-2016:  Defendant may serve Condition Time in Walworth County with Electronic Monitoring.
Consecutive to: Walworth County case

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexander C Beaver in court by phone, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for review hearing. 
Mr. Beaver is requesting any remaining restitution or fines left owing be converted to a civil judgment.
Attorney Thurston makes statements to the court. 
The Court amends it's prior order from February 10, 2018 and will extend probation for 1 year until February 12, 2019 instead of two years.  
Mr. Beaver to continue to make payments toward restitution.  The court will review the matter in February if required.

Defendant Alexander C Beaver in court with attorney Joseph J. Dorlack.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 8. Copy of CCAP record and copy of restitution summary filed by the State. Restitution hearing to be set as to Michael G. and American Family Insurance.


Court orders the following:
Ct. 8:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 18 months)  Stayed for 3 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution set in the amount $15.00 to Diane A., $2,178.09 to Emily R., $175.00 to Jenna S. and $719.96 to Randal S. to be paid as a condition of Probation. 
- Restitution hearing set as to Michael G. and American Family Insurance.  
- DNA Surcharge of$250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: No contact with any victims or any co-actors. Full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. Follow through with 
any other conditions recommended by Agent. DNA Sample if not yet provided.
 - 120 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing forthwith. Defendant to serve 1st 60 days jail consecutive to his Walworth County case. Non working hours with standard release conditions.  Last 60 days jail w/huber STAYED (consecutive) and to be used at the Agents discretion. If the defendant gets electronic monitoring w/Walworth County he can have Electronic monitoring in Waukesha County. Sentences are consecutive.
Sentencing hearing on February 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
filed by the State
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Alexander C Beaver in court with attorney Joseph J. Dorlack.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 8,  Court finds defendant guilty.   Ct. 7, 9, 10, 11 and 12 dismissed and read-in. Defense requests another date for sentencing. Court grants request. Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph J. Dorlack in court.   Defendant Alexander C Beaver did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion in limine addressed. There are no objections to the motions. Any other motions to be filed 10 days in advance of the jury status and a response to be filed in 2 days before the jury status. This case will take 3 days. Case continued as set.
Dated 12/10/14 filed by Attorney Dorlack requesting the Defendant's appearance be waived for the December 11, 2014 hearing.
Motion hearing on December 11, 2014 at 01:45 pm.
Filed by ADA Galaviz.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexander C Beaver in court with attorney Joseph J. Dorlack.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense addresses discovery and CD's. Defense is requesting a jury status/trial date. This case may take 2 - 3 days. Court grants request. Bail stands as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexander C Beaver in court with attorney Joseph J. Dorlack.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date to review discovery. Court grants request.  Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Alexander C Beaver in court with attorney Joseph J. Dorlack.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Criminal Complaint filed. Sargent Gwendolyn Bruckner from the Village of Eagle Police Department, sworn and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Dorlack. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. State moves for bind over. Closing statements presented by Atty. Dorlack.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 10:30 am.
